alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz; Kofa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 12:31PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central La Paz and north central Yuma Counties through 115 PM MST... At 1229 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms around the Kofa Mountains, or 36 miles northeast of Martinez Lake. These storms werre nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs, blow around unsecured objects, and generate blowing dust. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kofa Wildlife Refuge and Palm Canyon. This includes AZ Route 95 between mile markers 72 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
